subject: Re: detect test failure in teardown()
msgSnippet: Let me be more explicit - I have implemented a Base test class for all of my tests, NistTestBase. Here is a snippet: import junit.framework.TestCase; public
messageBody:
Let me be more explicit -

I have implemented a Base test class for all of my tests,
NistTestBase. Here is a snippet:


import junit.framework.TestCase;
public class NistTestBase extends TestCase {
public NistTestBase(String arg0) {
super(arg0);
}
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
// do setup things
}

protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
// do teardown things.

}


My tests all extend the base class:

package com.sas.nist;
public class TestDml extends NistTestBase {
protected void setUp() throws Exception {
super.setUp();
}

protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
super.tearDown();
}

}

I want to be able to put a hook into the NistTestBase class, to see if
I had a test failure. I tried this snippet, but it the failure and
error count is always 0. Is there a way to get at the "real"
TestResult for this run?

protected void tearDown() throws Exception {
String target = System.getProperty("test.db.target", "vul");
TestResult tr = new TestResult();
System.out.println ("HI");
System.out.println ("tr.failureCount: " + tr.failureCount());
System.out.println ("tr.errorCount: " + tr.errorCount());






--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Jeff Langr <Jeff.Langr@L...> wrote:
> Quoting Bill Oliver <bill.oliver@s...>:
>
> > Is there an easy way to determine if a test failed / erred during the
> > teardown() method?
>
> How about try/catch AssertionFailedError?
>
> -Jeff-
